children.name: show
Attach show event handler via bind(); detach via unbind()
Attach show event handler during initialization; detach via unbind()

children.description: Triggered just after a tab is being made visible, but before the end of the animation. Before *Q2 2014* this event was called *activate*.

children.name: select
Attach select event handler via bind(); detach via unbind()
Attach select event handler during initialization; detach via unbind()

children.description: Triggered before a tab is selected.

children.name: error
Attach error event handler during initialization; detach via unbind()

children.description: Triggered when an AJAX request results in an error.

children.name: contentLoad
Attach contentLoad event handler during initialization; detach via unbind()

children.description: Triggered when content is fetched from an AJAX request.

children.name: activate
Attach activate event handler via bind(); detach via unbind()
Attach activate event handler during initialization; detach via unbind()

children.description: Triggered after a tab is being made visible and its animation complete. Before *Q2 2014* this event was invoked *after tab show*, but *before* the end of the animation. This event is triggered only for tabs with associated content.

children.name: setDataSource
children.description: Sets the dataSource of an existing tabstrip and rebinds it.

children.name: select

parameters.name: element `String|Element|jQuery|Number`
parameters.description: The target tab(s), specified as a selector, jQuery object or index in the tab group.

children.description: Get/set the selected tab. If called without arguments, it returns thecurrently selected tab.

children.name: remove
Remove a tab with ID, tab1 from a TabStrip

parameters.name: element `String|Number|jQuery`
parameters.description: The target tab(s) to be removed, specified as a string selector, a jQuery object, or a zero-based item index.

children.description: Removes a specified tab from a TabStrip.

children.name: reload

parameters.name: element `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The target tab(s), specified as a selector or jQuery object, to be reloaded via AJAX.

children.description: Reloads TabStrip tab(s) via AJAX.

children.name: items
children.description:
Gets the list of DOM elements that represent the tabs.
  • Tab 1
  • Tab 2
Content 1
Content 2

children.name: insertBefore

parameters.name: referenceTab `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: A reference tab to insert the new item before

parameters.name: item `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: Target tab, specified as a JSON object. You can pass tab `text`, `content` or `contentUrl` here. Can handle anHTML string or array of such strings or JSON.

children.description: Inserts a newly-created tab before a specified tab.

children.name: insertAfter

parameters.name: referenceTab `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: A reference tab to insert the new item after.

parameters.name: item `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: Target tab, specified as a JSON object. You can pass tab `text`, `content` or `contentUrl` here. Can handle anHTML string or array of such strings or JSON.

children.description: Inserts a newly-created tab after a specified tab.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean` *(optional)*
parameters.description: Desired state of the tab(s) specified by the selector; enabled (**true**) or disabled(**false**).

parameters.name: element `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The target tab(s), specified as a selector, to be enabled (**true**) or disabled(**false**).

children.description: Disables (**false**) or enables (**true**) a tab(s) of a **TabStrip**.

children.name: disable

parameters.name: element `String|Element|jQuery`
parameters.description: The target tab(s), specified as a selector, to be disabled.

children.description: Disables a tab(s) of a **TabStrip**.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **TabStrip** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the TabStrip element from DOM.

children.name: deactivateTab

parameters.name: item `jQuery`
parameters.description: The target tab, specified as a selector, to be deactivated.

children.description: Deactivates a tab specified as a selector. Note: Invoking this method will not trigger any events.

children.name: contentHolder
Obtain the content holder representing the first tab in a TabStrip

parameters.name: itemIndex `Number`
parameters.description: The index of the tab in the TabStrip.

children.description: Obtains the DOM element that holds tab content by its tab index in the **TabStrip**.The difference between `contentElement` and `contentHolder` is that `contentHolder` returns the DOM element that really holds the content, which on mobile is the scroll container.> **Important:** To remove the tab contents safely, use this method to get the element to empty.

children.name: contentElement
Obtain the content element representing the first tab in a TabStrip

parameters.name: itemIndex `Number`
parameters.description: The index of the tab in the TabStrip.

children.description: Obtains the DOM element that encloses tab content by its tab index in the **TabStrip**.> **Important:** To remove the tab contents safely, use **contentHolder** to get the element to empty.

children.name: append

parameters.name: tab `Array|Object`
parameters.description: Target tab, specified as a JSON object. You can pass tab `text`, `content` or `contentUrl` here. Can handle an HTML string or array of such strings or JSON.

children.description: Appends a tab to the collection of tabs in a **TabStrip**.

children.name: activateTab

parameters.name: item `jQuery`
parameters.description: The target tab, specified as a selector, to be activated.

children.description: Activates a tab specified as a selector. Note: Invoking this method will not trigger any events.

children.name: value
children.description: Specifies the selectd tab. Should be corresponding to the dataTextField configuration and used when bound to a DataSource component.

children.name: tabPosition
children.description: Specifies the position of the widget tabs. Valid values are `"top"` (default), `"left"`, `"right"` and `"bottom"`.A [**fade animation**](#configuration-animation) is highly recommended with any of the non-default tab position settings.

children.name: scrollable.distance
children.description: Sets the scroll amount (in pixels) applied when the user clicks on a scroll button.

children.name: scrollable
children.description: If enabled, the TabStrip will display buttons that will scroll the tabs horizontally, when they cannot fit the TabStrip width. By default scrolling is enabled.The feature requires `"top"` or `"bottom"` [`tabPosition`](#configuration-tabPosition).Unless disabled, `scrollable` must be set to a JavaScript object, which represents the scrolling configuration.See [Scrollable Tabs](/controls/navigation/tabstrip/overview#configuration-Scrollable) for more information.

children.name: navigatable
children.description: Specifies whether the TabStrip should be keyboard navigatable.

children.name: dataUrlField
children.description: Sets the field of the data item that provides the link URL for the tab.

children.name: dataTextField
children.description: Sets the field of the data item that provides the text name of the tab.

children.name: dataSpriteCssClass
children.description: Sets the field of the data item that provides the CSS class of the tab.

children.name: dataSource
children.description: The data source of the widget which is used to display the items. Can be a JavaScript object which represents a valid data source configuration, a JavaScript array or an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource)instance.If the `dataSource` option is set to a JavaScript object or array the widget will initialize a new [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance using that value as data source configuration.If the `dataSource` option is an existing [kendo.data.DataSource](/api/javascript/data/datasource) instance the widget will use that instance and will **not** initialize a new one.

children.name: dataImageUrlField
children.description: Sets the field of the data item that provides the image URL of the tab.

children.name: dataContentUrlField
children.description: Sets the field of the data item that provides the URL for the Ajax loaded tab content.

children.name: dataContentField
children.description: Sets the field of the data item that provides the text content of the tab content element.

children.name: contentUrls
Example - specify that the second tab should be loaded remotely

children.description: Sets an array with the URLs from which the tabs content to be loaded from. If only specific tabs should be loaded via Ajax, then you should set the URLs to the corresponding positions in the array and set the other elements to null.

children.name: collapsible
children.description: Specifies whether the TabStrip should be able to collapse completely when clicking an expanded tab.

children.name: animation.open.effects
children.description: A whitespace-separated string of animation effects that are used when a new tab is shown. Options include**"expand:vertical"** and **"fadeIn"**.

children.name: animation.open.duration
children.description: The number of milliseconds used for the visual animation when a new tab is shown.

children.name: animation.open
children.description: The visual animation(s) that will be used when the new tab is shown.

children.name: animation.close.effects
children.description: A whitespace-delimited string of animation effects that are utilized when the current tabis closed. By default not specified - uses the opening animation with reverse.

children.name: animation.close.duration
children.description: The number of milliseconds used for the visual animation when the current tab is closed.

children.name: animation.close
children.description: The visual animation(s) that will be used when the current tab is closed.

children.name: animation
children.description: A collection of visual animations used when **TabStrip** tab are selected throughuser interactions. Setting this option to **false** will disable all animations.
